prev_m1_guidance_text: These actions should be done before Ihram. You may perform them at home or at the Miqat.
prev_m1_mighat_condition_item1: It is preferable to perform the Ihram bath at the Miqat
prev_m1_male_item2: Have two pieces of cloth (Rida and Izar) and sandals that do not cover the foot or the ankle
prev_m1_male_item3: Note: Entering Ihram before the Miqat incurs a penalty (kaffarah). It is better to plan the journey to the Miqat so that no sea travel occurs after entering Ihram.
ip1_general_item1: 1-Purity (wudu or ghusl) is not a condition for entering ihram; therefore, the ihram of a person who is in a state of janabah, menstruation, or postnatal bleeding is also valid
ip1_mighat_condition_item1: However, if one enters ihram inside a mosque, the rulings related to the mosque must be observed.
ip1_mighat_condition_item2: Since ihram is performed inside Masjid al-Shajarah, the mosque-related rulings must be observed.
ip1_general_item2: For entering ihram, being physically clean (body and clothing) is not required; therefore, a person may make the intention and recite the talbiyah even if their body or clothes are not clean. However, after entering ihram, purity of the ihram clothing becomes a requirement.
ip1_mighat_condition_item3: Certainty of reaching the miqat is required.
ip1_mighat_condition_item4: Entering ihram before or after the miqat is not valid.
